alert.note: Alert for Kalamazoo (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 17 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: .Slow moving thunderstorms were producing very heavy rainfall. Locally 2 to 4 inches of rain may accumulate before they shift south of the region. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Michigan, including the following county, Kalamazoo. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 342 PM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Romence road and Westnedge avenue is in the area of heaviest rainfall and will likely see the greatest impacts including in and around Crossroads Mall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kalamazoo, Portage, Eastwood, Kalamazoo-Battle Creek International Airport, Westwood and Comstock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
